version: epf-composer-1.0-RC1-N20060913-1745-win32

steps:
1 copy the string,    "t	est"
2 create a Cp and paste the string as its name, and then save
3 error dialog prompt.

remark:
 there is no problem to other content elements, like plug-in name, role name, task name,etc. They have disposed the tab character.

still has a problem. log file is below.

Created an attachment (id=50223)
screen snap: rename a role

The fix was for pasteing the tab containing name into the name entry of new cp dialog, as described by the original bug description.

The scenarios described in the re-opening bug report could be for a new bug entry, but indeed should be considered as the same bug from user perspective.

A clean fix to this bug for all potential cases would require touching code in many places, unless we refactor the code to allow the fix to be done in only on place. Too much risk for RC1. Will do it in RC2.

Well, I fixed the rename scenarios as described in the re-open report. Note that for the rename input dialog case, only check is performed, but not auto trim -> auto trim in this case would require some more effort for this type of widge -> not worth the effort. If similar bugs are found for other method elements other than process elements, may open a new bug or re-open this one. Please verify the fix, thanks

Checked with Phong: the UI guideline for such a case should be name checking only. Should not auto trim. Looks like we still have some inconsistency: 
"remark:
 there is no problem to other content elements, like plug-in name, role name,
task name,etc. They have disposed the tab character." -> In these cases, we should also just prompt to the user the error message, instead of auto trim the tab character.

"remark:
 there is no problem to other content elements, like plug-in name, role name,
task name,etc. They have disposed the tab character." -> In these cases, we
should also just prompt to the user the error message, instead of auto trim the
tab character.
Please file new bug for this, we will make it consistent in RC2. Thanks
